user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of try_match_header:
```c
static int
try_match_header (const char *prefix,
                  size_t prefix_len,
                  char *line,
                  char **suffix)
{
  if (NULL != *suffix)
    return MHD_NO;
  while (0 != *line)
  {
    if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_n_ (prefix,
                                   line,
                                   prefix_len))
    {
      *suffix = strdup (&line[prefix_len]);
      return MHD_YES;
    }
    ++line;
  }
  return MHD_NO;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function try_match_header:
int
MHD_str_equal_caseless_n_ (const char *const str1,
                           const char *const str2,
                           size_t maxlen)
{
  size_t i;

  for (i = 0; i < maxlen; ++i)
  {
    const char c1 = str1[i];
    const char c2 = str2[i];
    if (0 == c2)
      return 0 == c1;
    if (charsequalcaseless (c1, c2))
      continue;
    else
      return 0;
  }
  return ! 0;
}
...
_MHD_static_inline bool
charsequalcaseless (const char c1, const char c2)
{
  return ( (c1 == c2) ||
           (isasciiupper (c1) ?
            ((c1 - 'A' + 'a') == c2) :
            ((c1 == (c2 - 'A' + 'a')) && isasciiupper (c2))) );
}
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
suspicious_frags:
try_match_header (const char *prefix,
                  size_t prefix_len,
                  char *line,
                  char **suffix)
{
explanation: The remaining parts of the function do not need investigation for Rule 17.8: prefix is declared const and is not assigned anywhere; prefix_len (a non-pointer parameter) is not modified; the calls to MHD_str_equal_caseless_n_ and the underlying charsequalcaseless use const parameters and only read characters; no other assignments to the function parameters occur. Therefore only the shown fragments (the function parameter declarations and the loop/lines that perform pointer arithmetic/assignments) require further review.
